dialogue.text: The city has changed. Uncertainty is no longer diagnosis but recognized as human condition. We're healing collectively.
You're one of the question people, aren't you?
We all are. Some of us just know it.
Why does asking 'what am I?' feel like coming home?

visual_elements.cultural_markers: Uncertainty embraced in ads, art, education
visual_elements.generational_shift: Children growing up with normalized mystery

psychological_notes: Depicts cultural shift from pathologizing uncertainty to embracing it as human condition. Shows how individual transformation (Evan's journey) contributes to collective healing. Next generation (Maya) naturally inheriting healthier relationship with existential questions. Society developing 'uncertainty literacy.'
philosophical_underpinning: Individual healing contributes to and emerges from collective transformation
therapeutic_direction: Cultural normalization of existential uncertainty as healthy
